page.title: 14CORBY'S HOLIDAYS IN THE 80'S
page.content: Our class carried out a survey to discover what sort of holiday (one week or longer, spent away from home) are taken by people in our area. By sampling adults in our area we found that: 1) Most people (92%) had at least one holiday of a week or more. 2) 54% had one holiday per year. 32% had two holidays each year. 3) Just over half (54%) of the holidays taken were one week in length. 4) 61% of the holidays were taken in Britain. Most foreign holidays were spent in Europe with Spain being the most popular destination (31% of all foreign holidays). 5) A variety of types of accomodation were used. Almost one half of the holidays were based in guest houses and hotels.
